title: Government must put the full force of the law behind its crackdown on gagging clauses
text:
It is two years since the MeToo campaign gave women across the globe the opportunity to speak out, often for the first time, about the sexual harassment and discrimination they had personally endured at work. This week, the Government has published its response to the Women and Equalities Select Committee Report on the use of Non Disclosure Agreements (NDAs, or gagging clauses) to cover up allegations of this type of behaviour and other discrimination. I welcome the Government’s clear commitment to take action, but tough legislative follow-up is needed and there is much more to do.
